title: Pembrokeshire second home owner says 300% council tax premium is a 'kick' - BBC News
text: "Is it worth keeping the place?"

title: Pembrokeshire second home owner says 300% council tax premium is a 'kick' - BBC News
text: Retired doctor David Robinson said he now pays a 300% council tax premium on his wooden chalet in Burton, Pembrokeshire, which he purchased about 11 years ago so his six children and 11 grandchildren had somewhere to visit in west Wales.

title: Pembrokeshire second home owner says 300% council tax premium is a 'kick' - BBC News
text: He dubbed the recent 200% council tax increase on second homes on the Welsh coast "a kick" and "counterproductive" for an area reliant on tourism, adding that his place would be unsuitable as a permanent home for locals.

title: Pembrokeshire second home owner says 300% council tax premium is a 'kick' - BBC News
text: The number of second homes for sale in the county has trebled since council tax increased with 135 second homes in Pembrokeshire on the market in July.

title: Pembrokeshire second home owner says 300% council tax premium is a 'kick' - BBC News
text: "It is getting to the point now where, really, is it worth keeping the place?" said Dr Robinson from Llantrisant, Rhondda Cynon Taf.

title: Pembrokeshire second home owner says 300% council tax premium is a 'kick' - BBC News
text: He said he feared if he put it on the market it would not sell, with it being a wooden structure, and people would be unable to get a mortgage on it and would need cash to buy it.

title: Pembrokeshire second home owner says 300% council tax premium is a 'kick' - BBC News
text: Dr Robinson said he was sympathetic to the concerns of locals unable to get on the property market in Pembrokeshire, but said he didn't believe buying the chalet had taken away housing stock for locals.

title: Pembrokeshire second home owner says 300% council tax premium is a 'kick' - BBC News
text: "It's not really affecting anyone else’s market, it is purely for people visiting and short-term holidays," he said.

title: Pembrokeshire second home owner says 300% council tax premium is a 'kick' - BBC News
text: "It is a bit of a kick to see this disappearing.

title: Pembrokeshire second home owner says 300% council tax premium is a 'kick' - BBC News
text: "I think [the increased council tax for second-home owners] will be counter-productive."

title: Pembrokeshire second home owner says 300% council tax premium is a 'kick' - BBC News
text: Adam, 27, from Newport, Pembrokeshire, said despite having a well-paid job at a pharmaceutical company, property prices meant he was still living at home.

title: Pembrokeshire second home owner says 300% council tax premium is a 'kick' - BBC News
text: "The options are limited. Rent is expensive and the idea of getting a mortgage as a single person is very unlikely."

title: Pembrokeshire second home owner says 300% council tax premium is a 'kick' - BBC News
text: He said even if he did get a mortgage, he believed he would have to move outside of Pembrokeshire because of prices in the county.

title: Pembrokeshire second home owner says 300% council tax premium is a 'kick' - BBC News
text: "It's not ideal.

title: Pembrokeshire second home owner says 300% council tax premium is a 'kick' - BBC News
text: "I've always lived near the beach and not having that is going to be a bit of a shame, but that's the way it is."

title: Pembrokeshire second home owner says 300% council tax premium is a 'kick' - BBC News
text: He said the increase in council tax was no deterrent to second-home owners.

title: Pembrokeshire second home owner says 300% council tax premium is a 'kick' - BBC News
text: "If you can afford a second home in Newport that's just an easy way for the council to make money, it doesn't affect the home owners."

title: Pembrokeshire second home owner says 300% council tax premium is a 'kick' - BBC News
text: In April 2023, the maximum level at which local authorities in Wales could set council tax premiums on second homes increased to 300%, external.

title: Pembrokeshire second home owner says 300% council tax premium is a 'kick' - BBC News
text: The powers are discretionary, meaning the decision on whether to charge a premium on second homes is a decision made by each council individually.

title: Pembrokeshire second home owner says 300% council tax premium is a 'kick' - BBC News
text: Pembrokeshire council has increased council tax on second homes by 200%, while Gwynedd's council has increased the tax by 250%.

title: Pembrokeshire second home owner says 300% council tax premium is a 'kick' - BBC News
text: In addition, since 1 September, people in Gwynedd wanting to turn a house into a holiday let or a second home also need to get planning permission.

title: Pembrokeshire second home owner says 300% council tax premium is a 'kick' - BBC News
text: The council said this was to tackle what it called a "huge housing crisis".

title: Pembrokeshire second home owner says 300% council tax premium is a 'kick' - BBC News
text: The areas of Wales with the highest concentrations of holiday homes were Gwynedd, Anglesey and Pembrokeshire, external, according to the 2021 Census.

title: Pembrokeshire second home owner says 300% council tax premium is a 'kick' - BBC News
text: Council tax data from 2023-24 suggests that the area with the highest proportion of second homes was Gwynedd, external, where 8.3% of all homes - where council tax was payable – were classed as a second home. Pembrokeshire was the second highest, at 6.5%.

title: Pembrokeshire second home owner says 300% council tax premium is a 'kick' - BBC News
text: The number of second homes for sale in Pembrokeshire has trebled since the council tax increase. There were 135 second homes on the market in the county in July, compared to 38 the previous year, latest figures indicate.

title: Pembrokeshire second home owner says 300% council tax premium is a 'kick' - BBC News
text: From 1 April 2025, second home owners in England can be charged up to two times the normal council tax rate, external.

title: Pembrokeshire second home owner says 300% council tax premium is a 'kick' - BBC News
text: Just as in Wales, these powers are discretionary and can be made by each local authority individually.

title: Pembrokeshire second home owner says 300% council tax premium is a 'kick' - BBC News
text: Cornwall council has agreed to charge an additional 100% council tax premium on second homes from 1 April 2025, external.

title: Pembrokeshire second home owner says 300% council tax premium is a 'kick' - BBC News
text: by Teleri Glyn Jones

title: Pembrokeshire second home owner says 300% council tax premium is a 'kick' - BBC News
text: Second homes are an emotive issue- with rural and coastal areas of Wales fearing both the Welsh language and their communities are being hollowed out because young people can't afford to buy homes in their local area.

title: Pembrokeshire second home owner says 300% council tax premium is a 'kick' - BBC News
text: Coupled with the fact that those very same rural communities are so reliant on tourism, you have a thorny political issue.

title: Pembrokeshire second home owner says 300% council tax premium is a 'kick' - BBC News
text: The Labour Welsh government has been accused in the past of not doing enough to tackle these tensions and to deal with the root cause of them- a lack of affordable homes.

title: Pembrokeshire second home owner says 300% council tax premium is a 'kick' - BBC News
text: But in recent years there has been a more interventionist approach, with councils given the power to increase council tax on second homes and empty properties.

title: Pembrokeshire second home owner says 300% council tax premium is a 'kick' - BBC News
text: Here we see the potential consequences of those actions, and they appear to be having the desired effect - but of course the real measure of success will be whether those former second homes become family homes for local people.

title: Pembrokeshire second home owner says 300% council tax premium is a 'kick' - BBC News
text: If this was an easy problem to fix though, it would have been done by now. And there are many who fear the unintended consequences of creating a hostile environment to second home owners and holiday-makers.

title: Pembrokeshire second home owner says 300% council tax premium is a 'kick' - BBC News
text: Could tourism, the golden goose that sustains so many jobs along Wales' beautiful coastline, be the collateral damage of these well-meaning policies?

title: Cathay Pacific grounds planes after engine problem - BBC News
text: Hong Kong’s flagship airline Cathay Pacific has cancelled dozens of flights after a plane heading from the city to Zurich was forced to turn around due to an "engine component failure".

title: Cathay Pacific grounds planes after engine problem - BBC News
text: The company says it has now inspected all 48 of its Airbus A350s and found 15 aircraft with faulty parts that needed to be replaced.

title: Cathay Pacific grounds planes after engine problem - BBC News
text: The planes' Trent XWB-97 engines were made by British engineering giant Rolls-Royce.

title: Cathay Pacific grounds planes after engine problem - BBC News
text: Since Monday, Cathay Pacific has cancelled almost 70 flights, including routes linking Hong Kong to Sydney, Singapore, Bangkok, Tokyo, Seoul and Taipei.

title: Cathay Pacific grounds planes after engine problem - BBC News
text: Cathay Pacific said the disruptions will continue until at least Saturday.

title: Cathay Pacific grounds planes after engine problem - BBC News
text: "At Cathay, safety of our customers and our people guides every decision we make,"  the airline said.

title: Cathay Pacific grounds planes after engine problem - BBC News
text: "We sincerely apologise for the inconvenience caused and appreciate our customers’ patience and understanding."

title: Cathay Pacific grounds planes after engine problem - BBC News
text: Airbus did not immediately respond to a BBC request for comment.

title: Cathay Pacific grounds planes after engine problem - BBC News
text: Cathay Pacific took delivery of its first Airbus A350 aircraft in 2016. The planes are equipped with fuel-efficient Rolls-Royce engines.

title: Cathay Pacific grounds planes after engine problem - BBC News
text: Rolls-Royce told BBC News that "it is committed to working closely with the airline, aircraft manufacturer and the relevant authorities to support their efforts."

title: Cathay Pacific grounds planes after engine problem - BBC News
text: "As well as providing support and guidance to Cathay Pacific, Rolls-Royce will also keep other airlines that operate Trent XWB-97 engines fully informed of any relevant developments as appropriate."

title: Cathay Pacific grounds planes after engine problem - BBC News
text: Cathay Pacific's A350s also serve destinations in Europe and North America.

title: Cathay Pacific grounds planes after engine problem - BBC News
text: In a statement the European Union Aviation Safety Agency said it is “monitoring any information coming out of the technical investigation and will take decisions on any fleet level action as required.”

title: Cathay Pacific grounds planes after engine problem - BBC News
text: Other airlines that operate A350s include British Airways, Virgin Atlantic, Qatar Airways, Singapore Airlines and Japan Airlines. The BBC has contacted the companies for comment.

title: Cathay Pacific grounds planes after engine problem - BBC News
text: Singapore Airlines said "it is in contact with Airbus and Rolls-Royce on the ongoing issue with the Trent XWB engines"

title: Cathay Pacific grounds planes after engine problem - BBC News
text: Singapore Airlines said it "is inspecting the Rolls-Royce Trent XWB-84 engines that power our Airbus A350-900 fleet."

title: Cathay Pacific grounds planes after engine problem - BBC News
text: The company added that there is currently no impact on its flights.

title: Cathay Pacific grounds planes after engine problem - BBC News
text: Japan Airlines said it was awaiting information from Rolls-Royce, but added "as a precautionary measure", the company had decided to conduct inspections on its five Airbus A350-1000 aircraft "during their scheduled maintenance opportunities" at Haneda Airport on Tuesday.

title: Cathay Pacific grounds planes after engine problem - BBC News
text: It does not anticipate any flights to be delayed or cancelled as a result of the checks.

title: Cathay Pacific grounds planes after engine problem - BBC News
text: Qatar Airways said there had been "no impact on the operation of any Qatar Airways Airbus A350-1000s", but added it would monitor the situation.

title: Cathay Pacific grounds planes after engine problem - BBC News
text: This year, Rolls-Royce announced plans to invest heavily to improve its range of engines, including the Trent XWB-97.

title: Cathay Pacific grounds planes after engine problem - BBC News
text: In 2023, Tim Clark, the boss of gulf carrier Emirates, voiced concerns about the durability of the engine and the prices Rolls-Royce charged for maintenance.

title: How much can AI help tackle the next pandemic? - BBC News
text: It's been dubbed "Disease X"  - the next global pandemic, which some experts predict is pretty much bound to happen.

title: How much can AI help tackle the next pandemic? - BBC News
text: Over the next decade, according to certain forecasts, there's a one in four chance of another outbreak on the scale of Covid-19.

title: How much can AI help tackle the next pandemic? - BBC News
text: It could be influenza or coronavirus - or something completely new.

title: How much can AI help tackle the next pandemic? - BBC News
text: Covid-19, of course, infected and killed millions of people worldwide, so it's a frightening prospect.

title: How much can AI help tackle the next pandemic? - BBC News
text: So could AI help to alleviate it?

title: How much can AI help tackle the next pandemic? - BBC News
text: Researchers in California are developing an AI-based early warning system that will examine social media posts to help predict future pandemics.

title: How much can AI help tackle the next pandemic? - BBC News
text: The researchers, from University of California, Irvine (UCI) and the University of California, Los Angeles (UCLA), are part of the US National Science Foundation's Predictive Intelligence for Pandemic Prevention grant programme.

title: How much can AI help tackle the next pandemic? - BBC News
text: This funds research that “aims to identify, model, predict, track and mitigate the effects of future pandemics”.

title: How much can AI help tackle the next pandemic? - BBC News
text: The project builds on earlier work by UCI and UCLA researchers, including a searchable database of 2.3 billion US Twitter posts collected since 2015, to monitor public health trends.

title: How much can AI help tackle the next pandemic? - BBC News
text: Prof Chen Li is spearheading the project at UCI's Department of Computer Science. He says they have been collecting billions of tweets on X, formerly known as Twitter, over the past few years.

title: How much can AI help tackle the next pandemic? - BBC News
text: The tool works by figuring out which tweets are meaningful and training the algorithm to help to detect early signs of a future pandemic, predict upcoming outbreaks, and evaluate the potential outcomes of specific public health policies, says Prof Chen.

title: How much can AI help tackle the next pandemic? - BBC News
text: “We have developed a machine-learning model for identifying and categorising significant events that may be indicative of an upcoming epidemic from social media streams."

title: How much can AI help tackle the next pandemic? - BBC News
text: The tool, which is targeted at public health departments and hospitals, can also "evaluate the effects of treatments to the spread of viruses", he says.

title: How much can AI help tackle the next pandemic? - BBC News
text: However, it’s not without problems. For example, it is reliant on X, a platform not accessible in some countries.

title: How much can AI help tackle the next pandemic? - BBC News
text: “The availability of data outside the US has been mixed,” admits Prof Chen.

title: How much can AI help tackle the next pandemic? - BBC News
text: “So far our focus has been within the US. We are working to overcome the data scarcity and potential bias when we expand the coverage to other regions of the world.”

title: How much can AI help tackle the next pandemic? - BBC News
text: Developed by Harvard Medical School and the University of Oxford, an AI tool called EVEScape is making predictions about new variants of coronavirus.

title: How much can AI help tackle the next pandemic? - BBC News
text: Researchers are publishing a ranking of new variants every two weeks, and they claim that the tool has also made accurate predictions about other viruses, including HIV and influenza.

title: How much can AI help tackle the next pandemic? - BBC News
text: “One of the unique strengths of our approach is that it can be used early in a pandemic,” says Nikki Thadani, a former postdoctoral research fellow who was involved in the development of EVEScape.

title: How much can AI help tackle the next pandemic? - BBC News
text: “It could be good for... vaccine manufacturers, and also for people trying to identify therapeutics, particularly antibodies to get some insight early on into which mutations might arise even a year in the future.”

title: How much can AI help tackle the next pandemic? - BBC News
text: It's a point picked up by AstraZeneca's vice president of data science and AI R&D, Jim Wetherall.

title: How much can AI help tackle the next pandemic? - BBC News
text: The pharmaceutical giant uses AI to help speed up the discovery of new antibodies. Antibodies are proteins used by the body's immune system to fight off harmful substances. They can be used to make new vaccines.

title: How much can AI help tackle the next pandemic? - BBC News
text: Mr Wetherall says the firm can "generate and screen a library of antibodies and bring the highest quality predictions to the lab, reducing the number of antibodies that need to be tested, and cutting the time to identify target antibody leads from three months to three days".

title: How much can AI help tackle the next pandemic? - BBC News
text: This is helpful for pandemic preparedness, he says, "because as we have seen with Covid-19, the potential volatility of viruses means that we need quicker ways to identify candidates to keep up with rapidly mutating targets."

title: How much can AI help tackle the next pandemic? - BBC News
text: The Oslo-headquartered Coalition for Epidemic Preparedness Innovations (CEPI) - which funded EVEScape - views AI as a tool to help in its goal of preparing for and responding to epidemics and pandemics.

title: How much can AI help tackle the next pandemic? - BBC News
text: “We just have to be as broadly well prepared as possible,” says Dr In-Kyu Yoon, director, programmes and innovative technology at CEPI.

title: How much can AI help tackle the next pandemic? - BBC News
text: “And what AI does is it speeds up that that preparation process.”

title: How much can AI help tackle the next pandemic? - BBC News
text: However, he says AI still needs to develop and mature. “AI still depends on the information that is inputted, and I don't think anybody would say that we actually have all the information.

title: How much can AI help tackle the next pandemic? - BBC News
text: "Even if the AI then can try to evaluate, analyse it and predict from that, it's based on information that's put in. AI is a tool and the tool can be applied to various activities that can increase the quality and speed of the preparation for the next pandemic.

title: How much can AI help tackle the next pandemic? - BBC News
text: "[But] it would probably be wrong to say that AI can slow down or prevent the next pandemic. It's up to people to determine where to apply it.”

title: How much can AI help tackle the next pandemic? - BBC News
text: At the World Health Organization (WHO), Dr Philip AbdelMalik also highlights the role people play in AI's efficacy.

title: How much can AI help tackle the next pandemic? - BBC News
text: As the WHO's unit head of intelligence, innovation and integration, he says AI has definite value. It can pick up on chatter around particular symptoms, for example, and spot potential threats before governments have officially announced  them.

title: How much can AI help tackle the next pandemic? - BBC News
text: Also, it can pick up if people are advocating potentially dangerous treatments online so the WHO can step in.

title: How much can AI help tackle the next pandemic? - BBC News
text: However, while he can see its benefits, he is quick to flag up the challenges.

title: How much can AI help tackle the next pandemic? - BBC News
text: He says he’s always careful to say AI is not going to generate decisions for us. Plus, Dr AbdelMalik is concerned about the issues surrounding ethical use of AI and equitable representation.

title: How much can AI help tackle the next pandemic? - BBC News
text: “If I'm feeding it a lot of information that I'm not reviewing, and so it contains a lot of misinformation, or it's representative only of certain subpopulations, then what I'm going to get out is also going to be representative of just some subpopulations or contain a lot of misinformation.

title: How much can AI help tackle the next pandemic? - BBC News
text: "So it's that old adage of, you know, garbage in, garbage out.”

title: How much can AI help tackle the next pandemic? - BBC News
text: But overall, experts believe we’re in a better position for the next pandemic, partly because of the progress made in AI.

title: How much can AI help tackle the next pandemic? - BBC News
text: “I think this pandemic was kind of a wake-up call to a lot of people who think about this space,” says Nikki Thadani.

title: How much can AI help tackle the next pandemic? - BBC News
text: “Our model [AI tool EVEScape], and a lot of other efforts to really refine how we think about epidemiology, and how we think about leveraging the sort of data that you can have before a pandemic, and then integrating it with the data that's coming in through a pandemic, that does make me feel better about our ability to handle pandemics in the future.”

title: How much can AI help tackle the next pandemic? - BBC News
text: But, she says, there's a long way to go both on more of the fundamental biology and modelling she has worked in, but in epidemiology and public health more broadly, to help make us more prepared for future pandemics.

title: How much can AI help tackle the next pandemic? - BBC News
text: “We're much better off now than we were three years ago,” says Dr AbdelMalik.

title: How much can AI help tackle the next pandemic? - BBC News
text: "However, there’s something more important than technology to help us when the next pandemic hits, and that’s trust.

title: How much can AI help tackle the next pandemic? - BBC News
text: “Technology to me is not our limiting factor. I think we really have to work on relationships, on information sharing and building trust. We keep saying that, everybody's saying that, but are we actually doing it?"

title: Brazil X ban: Top court judges uphold block of Musk's platform - BBC News
text: Brazil's Supreme Court has upheld a ban on social media platform X, formerly known as Twitter.

title: Brazil X ban: Top court judges uphold block of Musk's platform - BBC News
text: The judges voted unanimously in favour of the measure, meaning the ban will stay in place.

title: Brazil X ban: Top court judges uphold block of Musk's platform - BBC News
text: X has been suspended in Brazil since the early hours of Saturday after it failed to appoint a new legal representative in the country before a court-imposed deadline.

title: Brazil X ban: Top court judges uphold block of Musk's platform - BBC News
text: It is the latest development in a feud between Supreme Court Justice Alexandre de Moraes and X's owner Elon Musk which began in April, when the judge ordered the suspension of dozens of accounts for allegedly spreading disinformation.

title: Brazil X ban: Top court judges uphold block of Musk's platform - BBC News
text: Justice Moraes had called for the five-member panel to rule on the suspension, which has caused division in Brazil.

title: Brazil X ban: Top court judges uphold block of Musk's platform - BBC News
text: One of the justices, Flávio Dino, argued that "freedom of expression is closely linked to a duty of responsibility".

title: Brazil X ban: Top court judges uphold block of Musk's platform - BBC News
text: "The first can't exist without the second, and vice-versa," he added.

title: Brazil X ban: Top court judges uphold block of Musk's platform - BBC News
text: Reacting to the decision to ban X, Mr Musk had earlier said: "Free speech is the bedrock of democracy and an unelected pseudo-judge in Brazil is destroying it for political purposes."

title: Brazil X ban: Top court judges uphold block of Musk's platform - BBC News
text: In his ruling, Justice Moraes gave companies, including Apple and Google, a five-day deadline to remove X from its app stores and block its use on iOS and Android devices.

title: Brazil X ban: Top court judges uphold block of Musk's platform - BBC News
text: He added that individuals or businesses that are found to still be accessing X by using virtual private networks (VPNs) could be fined R$50,000 ($8,910; £6,780).

title: Brazil X ban: Top court judges uphold block of Musk's platform - BBC News
text: X closed its office in Brazil last month, saying its representative had been threatened with arrest if she did not comply with orders it described as "censorship", which it said was illegal under Brazilian law.

title: Brazil X ban: Top court judges uphold block of Musk's platform - BBC News
text: Justice Moraes had ordered that X accounts accused of spreading disinformation - many of which belonged to supporters of the former right-wing president Jair Bolsonaro - must be blocked while they are under investigation.

title: Brazil X ban: Top court judges uphold block of Musk's platform - BBC News
text: Brazil is said to be one of the largest markets for Mr Musk's social media network.

title: Brazil X ban: Top court judges uphold block of Musk's platform - BBC News
text: With access to X blocked, many Brazilians have been turning to microblogging platform Bluesky as an alternative.

title: Brazil X ban: Top court judges uphold block of Musk's platform - BBC News
text: Bluesky announced on Saturday that it had registered half a million new users in the South American country over the two previous days alone.

title: Brazil X ban: Top court judges uphold block of Musk's platform - BBC News
text: Among those pointing followers to his Bluesky account was Brazil's president, Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva, who on Thursday tweeted links to his social media accounts on platforms other than X., external

title: Brazil X ban: Top court judges uphold block of Musk's platform - BBC News
text: Lula's Bluesky profile was top of the list, which also included links to his Instagram, WhatsApp, Threads, TikTok and Facebook accounts.

title: Brazil X ban: Top court judges uphold block of Musk's platform - BBC News
text: Bluesky CEO Jay Graber expressed her delight at the influx of new users, posting in Portuguese and English: "Good job Brazil, you made the right choice."

title: Trial of ex-VW boss begins over 'dieselgate' emissions scandal - BBC News
text: The former boss of Volkswagen has appeared in court charged with fraud, market manipulation and perjury, nine years after the carmaker was found to have rigged emissions tests.

title: Trial of ex-VW boss begins over 'dieselgate' emissions scandal - BBC News
text: Martin Winterkorn was chief executive of the German company in 2015 when it was engulfed in a scandal that sent shockwaves through the entire industry.

title: Trial of ex-VW boss begins over 'dieselgate' emissions scandal - BBC News
text: It emerged the company had been deliberately manipulating official emissions checks, building cars that could pass laboratory tests while producing illegal levels of pollution in daily use.

title: Trial of ex-VW boss begins over 'dieselgate' emissions scandal - BBC News
text: Tuesday marked the start of the Mr Winterkorn's trial. He denies the charges.

title: Trial of ex-VW boss begins over 'dieselgate' emissions scandal - BBC News
text: "Our client did not defraud or harm anyone, he did not deliberately leave the capital market in the dark so that investors would be harmed, and he told the investigating committee the truth," his lawyers said.

title: Trial of ex-VW boss begins over 'dieselgate' emissions scandal - BBC News
text: The so-called "dieselgate" affair erupted in September 2015, when the US Environmental Protection Agency accused Volkswagen of installing illegal software on diesel cars.

title: Trial of ex-VW boss begins over 'dieselgate' emissions scandal - BBC News
text: It developed into one of the biggest corporate scandals Germany had ever seen, and sparked off a political drive towards electric vehicles which has had a profound effect on the industry around the world.

title: Trial of ex-VW boss begins over 'dieselgate' emissions scandal - BBC News
text: The former chief executive stands accused of deliberately duping Volkswagen’s customers and shareholders, as well as German politicians. If found guilty, the 77-year-old could face up to 10 years in prison.

title: Trial of ex-VW boss begins over 'dieselgate' emissions scandal - BBC News
text: The affair had its origins in a drive by the carmaker to increase sales in North America, particularly of diesel cars - which it marketed as "clean diesels".

title: Trial of ex-VW boss begins over 'dieselgate' emissions scandal - BBC News
text: The reality, however, was that those cars were not clean. The company had been struggling to get its engines to meet stringent US emissions standards while maintaining high performance and reliability.

title: Trial of ex-VW boss begins over 'dieselgate' emissions scandal - BBC News
text: The solution its engineers came up with was to develop so-called "defeat devices". These were software that recognised when a car was being tested in the laboratory, and turned on emissions controls so that it could pass the tests.

title: Trial of ex-VW boss begins over 'dieselgate' emissions scandal - BBC News
text: When the car was out on the road, it would turn them off again in order to boost performance.

title: Trial of ex-VW boss begins over 'dieselgate' emissions scandal - BBC News
text: It subsequently emerged that the scam had been operating since 2006, and that more than nine million vehicles in Europe and North America had been fitted with the software.

title: Trial of ex-VW boss begins over 'dieselgate' emissions scandal - BBC News
text: Brands throughout the Volkswagen corporate empire were affected, including Audi, Porsche, Seat and Skoda as well as Volkswagen itself.

title: Trial of ex-VW boss begins over 'dieselgate' emissions scandal - BBC News
text: Volkswagen had to pay hefty fines, issue recalls and compensate consumers. The affair cost it more than €30bn (£25.2bn).

title: Trial of ex-VW boss begins over 'dieselgate' emissions scandal - BBC News
text: Mr Winterkorn, who had been chief executive since 2007, stepped down within days of the scandal coming to light. Indicted in 2019, he was meant to stand trial in 2021 alongside other executives, but the proceedings were delayed due to concerns about his health.

title: Trial of ex-VW boss begins over 'dieselgate' emissions scandal - BBC News
text: Two of the charges against him have been brought by prosecutors in Braunschweig, close to Volkswagen's headquarters in the Lower Saxony town of Wolfsburg.

title: Trial of ex-VW boss begins over 'dieselgate' emissions scandal - BBC News
text: They have accused him of fraud, because buyers were "deceived about the characteristics" of the cars they were buying and faced collective losses of hundreds of millions of euros as a result of the scandal.

title: Trial of ex-VW boss begins over 'dieselgate' emissions scandal - BBC News
text: He has also been accused of market manipulation, after allegedly failing to inform investors about the emissions-rigging software once he became aware of it.

title: Trial of ex-VW boss begins over 'dieselgate' emissions scandal - BBC News
text: A further indictment comes from the Berlin prosecutor’s office. It has accused Mr Winterkorn of giving false testimony to a parliamentary committee that was investigating the scandal in 2017.

title: Trial of ex-VW boss begins over 'dieselgate' emissions scandal - BBC News
text: Volkswagen chairman Hans Dieter Poetsch and the former head of the brand, Herbert Diess were both charged with market manipulation. But those charges were dropped after the company agreed to pay a fine of €9m

title: Trial of ex-VW boss begins over 'dieselgate' emissions scandal - BBC News
text: The former Audi chief executive, Rupert Stadler received a fine of €1.1m and a 21-month suspended jail sentence, after admitting to fraud by negligence over his role in the affair.

title: Trial of ex-VW boss begins over 'dieselgate' emissions scandal - BBC News
text: All were indicted in Germany. By contrast, former engineer Oliver Schmidt went on trial in the US. He was sentenced to seven years in jail in 2017, but was released in 2021.

title: Trial of ex-VW boss begins over 'dieselgate' emissions scandal - BBC News
text: Mr Winterkorn has already paid €11m to his former company as part of a settlement in relation to the scandal.

title: Grangemouth: Scotland's only oil refinery to close next year - BBC News
text: Scotland's only oil refinery is to close by the summer of next year, with the loss of 400 jobs.

title: Grangemouth: Scotland's only oil refinery to close next year - BBC News
text: Petroineos said the closure of Grangemouth was due to it being unable to compete with sites in Asia, Africa and the Middle East.

title: Grangemouth: Scotland's only oil refinery to close next year - BBC News
text: The company said the decision would "safeguard fuel supply for Scotland" by converting the site into a terminal able to import petrol, diesel, aviation fuel and kerosene into Scotland - but would require a workforce of fewer than 100 employees compared to the current 475.

title: Grangemouth: Scotland's only oil refinery to close next year - BBC News
text: The company announced last November it intended to close the plant, but union leaders had hoped the facility could remain open longer to provide time for a green alternative to be established at the site.

title: Grangemouth: Scotland's only oil refinery to close next year - BBC News
text: The BBC understands the refinery - the oldest in the UK - is currently losing around $500,000 (£383,000) a day and is on course to lose around $200m (£153m) in 2024.

title: Grangemouth: Scotland's only oil refinery to close next year - BBC News
text: Petroineos said they expected the new hub for finished fuels to open by early summer next year.

title: Grangemouth: Scotland's only oil refinery to close next year - BBC News
text: First Minister John Swinney said he was "deeply disappointed" at the news, while a joint three-point plan was unveiled by the Scottish and UK governments regarding the future of the site.

title: Grangemouth: Scotland's only oil refinery to close next year - BBC News
text: Workers said the announcement was a "kick in the teeth" while unions labelled it a "terrible indictment" of both governments and of the company.

title: Grangemouth: Scotland's only oil refinery to close next year - BBC News
text: The refinery was opened by BP in 1924.

title: Grangemouth: Scotland's only oil refinery to close next year - BBC News
text: It expanded into petrochemicals in the 1950s and serves as the primary supplier of aviation fuel for Scotland's main airports, while being a major supplier of petrol and diesel ground fuels across the Central Belt.

title: Grangemouth: Scotland's only oil refinery to close next year - BBC News
text: It accounts for about 14% of the UK's overall refining capacity and supplies almost two-thirds (65%) of demand for refined oil products in Scotland.

title: Grangemouth: Scotland's only oil refinery to close next year - BBC News
text: Ineos acquired the site in 2005 and are responsible for the entire plant, while the the refinery itself is owned by Petroineos - a joint venture between Ineos and PetroChina.

title: Grangemouth: Scotland's only oil refinery to close next year - BBC News
text: Petroineos stated that the size of the site meant that "high levels of capital expenditure each year" were spent on it, which outweighed the company's earnings.

title: Grangemouth: Scotland's only oil refinery to close next year - BBC News
text: Frank Demay, the company's CEO, said: "Demand for key fuels we produce at Grangemouth has already started to decline and, with a ban on new petrol and diesel cars due to come into force within the next decade, we foresee that the market for those fuels will shrink further.

title: Grangemouth: Scotland's only oil refinery to close next year - BBC News
text: "That reality, aligned with the cost of maintaining a refinery built half a century ago, means we are exploring ways to adapt our business.

title: Grangemouth: Scotland's only oil refinery to close next year - BBC News
text: “The action we are taking to create an import terminal will safeguard fuel supply for Scotland. We currently expect Grangemouth to be ready to operate as a national distribution hub for finished fuels in Q2 next year."

title: Grangemouth: Scotland's only oil refinery to close next year - BBC News
text: Between 250 to 280 of the redundancies are expected to occur in the three months after the plant closes, with 100 retained for between six to 12 months to help decommission and to build up the import business: , with a further 20 working on decommissioning and10 to manage demolition, which will continue until 2030.

title: Grangemouth: Scotland's only oil refinery to close next year - BBC News
text: 20 jobs will go at Finnart on Loch Long, which is the pipeline terminal taking much of the Gulf of Mexico and South American crude oil.

title: Grangemouth: Scotland's only oil refinery to close next year - BBC News
text: In a social media post the first minister stated the Scottish government would work closely with the UK government to "deliver an investment plan" that would help to "secure an industrial future for the site".

title: Grangemouth: Scotland's only oil refinery to close next year - BBC News
text: This will see £100m of funding to support local energy projects, and examining options - via a feasibility study called Project Willow - to build a new long-term industry at the refinery site.

title: Grangemouth: Scotland's only oil refinery to close next year - BBC News
text: But a source close to the firm said even if such plans were viable they would not come in time to save the jobs which are expected to be lost next year.

title: Grangemouth: Scotland's only oil refinery to close next year - BBC News
text: The UK government energy secretary Ed Milliband said the two governments were "working in lockstep" to protect jobs and invest in the area.

title: Grangemouth: Scotland's only oil refinery to close next year - BBC News
text: Chris Hamilton, a plant operator who has worked at Grangemouth for 11 years, told BBC Scotland News the closure would have a huge impact on the area.

title: Grangemouth: Scotland's only oil refinery to close next year - BBC News
text: He said: "This site dominates the local skyline, it has dominated the local economy and it has dominated the local jobs market. As a worker, we have known about this since last November but hearing it today isn't any easier."

title: Grangemouth: Scotland's only oil refinery to close next year - BBC News
text: Mr Hamilton, a union official at the plant, added: "It's a kick in the teeth. It seems like we have not really started [looking at] the alternative possibilities for the site and yet here we are facing closure next year. I don't know where I'll go next."

title: Grangemouth: Scotland's only oil refinery to close next year - BBC News
text: Petroineos said it has invested more than $1.2bn (£900m) in the refinery since 2011 while recording losses of more than $775m (£594m) during the same period.

title: Grangemouth: Scotland's only oil refinery to close next year - BBC News
text: The company had also been under pressure to decide whether to spend money on securing a new licence for its crude distillation unit, which was due to expire next spring.

title: Grangemouth: Scotland's only oil refinery to close next year - BBC News
text: Insiders say that doing so would have involved an investment of £40m, said to be an unattractive prospect given the scale of the plant's losses.

title: Grangemouth: Scotland's only oil refinery to close next year - BBC News
text: Derek Thomson, the Scottish secretary of trade union Unite, said: "There's been no plan by the UK or the Scottish government and what we're effectively going to see is 400 workers put on the scrapheap".

title: Grangemouth: Scotland's only oil refinery to close next year - BBC News
text: He added that the decision would have "devastating consequences" for the wider area.

title: Grangemouth: Scotland's only oil refinery to close next year - BBC News
text: Consultation on the redundancies will begin this month.

title: Grangemouth: Scotland's only oil refinery to close next year - BBC News
text: The firm said the new terminal would be able to import petrol, diesel, aviation fuel and kerosene into Scotland from vessels arriving via the Firth of Forth.

title: Grangemouth: Scotland's only oil refinery to close next year - BBC News
text: Grangemouth is one of six refineries in the UK and the only one in Scotland.

title: Grangemouth: Scotland's only oil refinery to close next year - BBC News
text: In recent years the site has been targeted by environmental protestors calling for it to be closed.

title: Grangemouth: Scotland's only oil refinery to close next year - BBC News
text: Scottish Labour leader Anas Sarwar called the news "a deeply disappointing decision".

title: Grangemouth: Scotland's only oil refinery to close next year - BBC News
text: Michelle Thomson, the Falkirk East MSP, called for similar support for Grangemouth as that provided for Tata Steel earlier this week, to help ease the green transition.

title: Grangemouth: Scotland's only oil refinery to close next year - BBC News
text: At First Minister's Questions she said she had been in discussions with a third party regarding a purchase of the refinery, and later told BBC Scotland it was an international company not based in Russia.

title: Grangemouth: Scotland's only oil refinery to close next year - BBC News
text: A spokesman for Petroineos told BBC Scotland that there had been "plenty of time" for potential buyers to express an interest and that it would "have engaged seriously with any credible proposition".

title: Grangemouth: Scotland's only oil refinery to close next year - BBC News
text: The spokesman added the company had reached out to Thomson for further details.

title: Grangemouth: Scotland's only oil refinery to close next year - BBC News
text: The INEOS businesses at Grangemouth - INEOS O&P UK and INEOS FPS - released a statement saying it was "“business as usual” for those companies.

title: Grangemouth: Scotland's only oil refinery to close next year - BBC News
text: This is what the energy transition looks like, and it’s neither "just" nor attractive for those at the sharp end.

title: Grangemouth: Scotland's only oil refinery to close next year - BBC News
text: Not only has Grangemouth refinery faced competition from more modern, efficient plants elsewhere: not only is the flow of North Sea oil reducing to uneconomic levels: but with the demise of petrol and diesel vehicles, and eventually greener aircraft, demand is expected to plummet in its domestic market.

title: Grangemouth: Scotland's only oil refinery to close next year - BBC News
text: So from a climate change perspective, no further oil refining should be welcomed.

title: Grangemouth: Scotland's only oil refinery to close next year - BBC News
text: But it looks less welcome from the point of view of a strategic economic asset in a world where energy security is a much higher priority than it was, with the decision to close being taken by a joint venture half of which is very close to the Chinese government.

title: Grangemouth: Scotland's only oil refinery to close next year - BBC News
text: To make this a "just transition", as governments would like it to be for energy workers and consumers, a biofuel or hydrogen refinery would be taking its place as the oil business winds down.

title: Grangemouth: Scotland's only oil refinery to close next year - BBC News
text: At Grangemouth, that’s a long way over the horizon, and long after 400 jobs have gone.

title: Grangemouth: Scotland's only oil refinery to close next year - BBC News
text: As with the steelworks at Port Talbot, seeing many more job losses this week in a tougher Welsh jobs market than Grangemouth, the newer, greener replacement technology requires fewer workers.

title: Grangemouth: Scotland's only oil refinery to close next year - BBC News
text: The transition also requires better advance planning. The biofuels market doesn't exist at scale. It requires the UK government to shape it, providing a price floor for Sustainable Aviation Fuel, for instance, so as to reduce investor risk.

title: Reliance-Disney: A mega merger aims to reshape India's entertainment landscape - BBC News
text: Imagine binge-watching The Bear, Succession, Deadpool and reality show Bigg Boss all on one platform - an entertainment bonanza  could be just around the corner for Indians if a blockbuster streaming merger goes through as expected.

title: Reliance-Disney: A mega merger aims to reshape India's entertainment landscape - BBC News
text: The deal, which brings together the media assets of India's largest conglomerate Reliance Industries and entertainment giant Walt Disney, has sparked both excitement and concerns over potential monopolistic dominance in the Indian entertainment and advertising industries.

title: Reliance-Disney: A mega merger aims to reshape India's entertainment landscape - BBC News
text: The $8.5bn (£6.5bn) merger aims to create India's largest entertainment company, potentially capturing 40% of the TV market, reaching 750 million viewers across 120 channels, and dominating the advertising sector.

title: Reliance-Disney: A mega merger aims to reshape India's entertainment landscape - BBC News
text: This gives Disney a stronger foothold in the challenging Indian market while supporting Reliance's expansion efforts. It also pits the new entertainment behemoth against popular rivals such as Netflix, Amazon Prime Video, Sony and 50-odd other streaming platforms.

title: Reliance-Disney: A mega merger aims to reshape India's entertainment landscape - BBC News
text: Consider the reach of this new entertainment giant: Disney's Star India operates more than 70 TV channels in eight languages, while Reliance's Viacom18 runs 38 channels in eight languages. Both own major streaming platforms - Jio Cinema and Hotstar - and film studios.

title: Reliance-Disney: A mega merger aims to reshape India's entertainment landscape - BBC News
text: India approves $8.5bn Reliance-Disney entertainment mega-merger

title: Reliance-Disney: A mega merger aims to reshape India's entertainment landscape - BBC News
text: Their influence is further amplified by owning the broadcasting rights to a significant number of India's sports events, including the hugely popular Indian Premier League cricket tournament.

title: Reliance-Disney: A mega merger aims to reshape India's entertainment landscape - BBC News
text: In a cricket-obsessed nation, this is a prime business position. The merged entity is estimated to control 75-80% of the Indian sports streaming market across both linear TV and digital platforms, according to Elara Capital, a global investment and advisory firm.

title: Reliance-Disney: A mega merger aims to reshape India's entertainment landscape - BBC News
text: Their dominance in this sector, especially cricket, means that Reliance and Disney will command a substantial share of the overall advertisement market. It showcases “strong growth in an industry where sports is a key driver of viewership on both TV and digital platforms”, says Karan Taurani, an analyst at Elara Capital, who calls it a "large media juggernaut".

title: Reliance-Disney: A mega merger aims to reshape India's entertainment landscape - BBC News
text: Though the merger promises to offer consumers diverse content, critics wonder if it puts too much power in the hands of one player.

title: Reliance-Disney: A mega merger aims to reshape India's entertainment landscape - BBC News
text: “The emergence of a giant in the market… with the next competitor struggling with market share in a single digit, would make any competition agency sit up and take notice,” says KK Sharma, who formerly headed the merger control division of the Competition Commission of India (CCI).

title: Reliance-Disney: A mega merger aims to reshape India's entertainment landscape - BBC News
text: This is why, analysts say, India’s competition watchdog scrutinised the agreement before approving the deal with a caveat that makes it “subject to the compliance of voluntary modifications".

title: Reliance-Disney: A mega merger aims to reshape India's entertainment landscape - BBC News
text: The companies have not made these “voluntary modifications” public yet, but reports say that the two companies have pledged to not raise advertising rates excessively while streaming cricket matches.

title: Reliance-Disney: A mega merger aims to reshape India's entertainment landscape - BBC News
text: The deal hinges on these assurances, Mr Sharma adds, because the CCI "retains its authority to even divide the enterprise - if the dominant enterprise becomes a threat to competition in the market”.

title: Reliance-Disney: A mega merger aims to reshape India's entertainment landscape - BBC News
text: In an increasingly competitive but expanding Indian streaming market, both Disney and Reliance have a lot to gain from the deal, which allows them a chance to consolidate their pole position.

title: Reliance-Disney: A mega merger aims to reshape India's entertainment landscape - BBC News
text: But experts warn that it may also mean a potential drop in the business earnings of smaller players.

title: Reliance-Disney: A mega merger aims to reshape India's entertainment landscape - BBC News
text: "The Indian market values bundling and is price-sensitive. [Subscribing to] this combined entity can offer a comprehensive package including [access to] web series, movies, sports, original content, and a global catalogue," says Mr Taurani.

title: Reliance-Disney: A mega merger aims to reshape India's entertainment landscape - BBC News
text: And if the combined company can also leverage the large telecom subscriber base of Reliance Jio, other streaming companies may find it hard to raise prices, he adds.

title: Reliance-Disney: A mega merger aims to reshape India's entertainment landscape - BBC News
text: The Reliance Group has a tried-and-tested business strategy that has allowed it to thrive in the price-sensitive Indian market: it offered cheap mobile data when it launched Jio in 2016, and its JioCinema streaming subscription is available for as little as 29 rupees ($0.35; $0.26) a month.

title: Reliance-Disney: A mega merger aims to reshape India's entertainment landscape - BBC News
text: From this deal too, Reliance chairman Mukesh Ambani has promised “unparalleled content at affordable prices”.

title: Reliance-Disney: A mega merger aims to reshape India's entertainment landscape - BBC News
text: Netflix: How did the streaming service turn its fortunes around?

title: Reliance-Disney: A mega merger aims to reshape India's entertainment landscape - BBC News
text: "Other streaming platforms will be worried about the cost of content and the cost of programming. Will they be forced to drop prices?" says media and entertainment industry specialist Vanita Kohli-Khandekar. She says that the Reliance strategy of offering things at throwaway prices usually "destroys value" for competitors.

title: Reliance-Disney: A mega merger aims to reshape India's entertainment landscape - BBC News
text: Streaming competitors might be easier to handle but the new company will also face stiff challenge from other rivals with deep pockets, such as Google, Meta and Amazon, who have been trying to expand in India.

title: Reliance-Disney: A mega merger aims to reshape India's entertainment landscape - BBC News
text: These global tech giants have "played a pivotal role in expanding India’s video market, now estimated to be worth $8.8bn in revenue for content owners", according to a report by research firm Media Partners Asia. In 2022-23, Google's YouTube alone had an 88% share in India's premium video-on-demand (VOD) market.

title: Reliance-Disney: A mega merger aims to reshape India's entertainment landscape - BBC News
text: So the new Reliance-Disney behemoth will hope to dominate not just news, movies and sports, but also redirect digital advertising revenues from these big firms to its own coffers.

title: Reliance-Disney: A mega merger aims to reshape India's entertainment landscape - BBC News
text: “Now, it’s an even fight,” says Ms Kohli-Khandekar. “Some 80% of digital revenues go to Google and Meta, so you have to have scale, and finally, you have a company that can take on some of the large global majors operating in India."

title: Reliance-Disney: A mega merger aims to reshape India's entertainment landscape - BBC News
text: But she warns that while the new entity might have scale and heft, it will also need to deliver quality with quantity - if, for instance, the streaming market becomes more dependent on views rather than subscriptions, "programming quality will be good only on one or two apps", she says.

title: Reliance-Disney: A mega merger aims to reshape India's entertainment landscape - BBC News
text: “That is something I would watch out for.”

title: Tipping: New law allows cafe worker to treat nan at Christmas - BBC News
text: A cafe worker says she will be able to treat her grandmother to extra gifts this Christmas thanks to a new law which means staff will receive all tips left by customers.

title: Tipping: New law allows cafe worker to treat nan at Christmas - BBC News
text: Leah Williams is one of thousands of workers in cafes, restaurants and beauty salons across Wales who will benefit from the legislation change.

title: Tipping: New law allows cafe worker to treat nan at Christmas - BBC News
text: Companies currently have the choice whether to keep tips made via card or pass them on to employees, while cash tips belong to staff.

title: Tipping: New law allows cafe worker to treat nan at Christmas - BBC News
text: According to the UK government, millions of workers in the UK are expected to take home a total of £200m more.

title: Tipping: New law allows cafe worker to treat nan at Christmas - BBC News
text: Ms Williams said: “My nan’s really important to me, I feel like I want to give her the world but I can’t.”

title: Tipping: New law allows cafe worker to treat nan at Christmas - BBC News
text: The 25-year-old, who lives with her grandmother, works at Greedy Fellas cafe in Swansea indoor market.

title: Tipping: New law allows cafe worker to treat nan at Christmas - BBC News
text: She said the tips she received were “really important” to her since she started working there after leaving school at 16.

title: Tipping: New law allows cafe worker to treat nan at Christmas - BBC News
text: “It helps me a lot with my bills because the cost of living is going up. I run my own car, I need to pay my insurance, tax and my phone bill,” she said.

title: Tipping: New law allows cafe worker to treat nan at Christmas - BBC News
text: Ms Williams currently receives all her tips from her employer, but another cafe owner said the new law would encourage more tips from customers, allowing staff to take home more money.

title: Tipping: New law allows cafe worker to treat nan at Christmas - BBC News
text: In 2021, the UK government said 80% of all tipping was taking place with a card, suggesting it had become easier for businesses to keep the money.

title: Tipping: New law allows cafe worker to treat nan at Christmas - BBC News
text: The law, which will come into force across Wales, England and Scotland in October, will make it illegal for businesses not to pass the tips on to their staff.

title: Tipping: New law allows cafe worker to treat nan at Christmas - BBC News
text: Under the new regime, a statutory code of conduct on fair and transparent tipping will also come into force, aimed at giving employees the right to see their employers’ tipping policies and a record of how many tips are given.

title: Tipping: New law allows cafe worker to treat nan at Christmas - BBC News
text: Jenny Morgan, who owns Full of Graze cafe in Mumbles, Swansea, said tips were always distributed to her staff directly after each shift, with card tips only recently being accepted.

title: Tipping: New law allows cafe worker to treat nan at Christmas - BBC News
text: She said she thought the new act would “encourage more customers to give tips”.

title: Tipping: New law allows cafe worker to treat nan at Christmas - BBC News
text: “I think it’s great, because customers will know the tips will be going directly to the individuals that served them,” she said.

title: Tipping: New law allows cafe worker to treat nan at Christmas - BBC News
text: “If the staff know they’re going to get tips or benefits by working, I definitely think it could encourage more staff to work in the sector.”

title: Tipping: New law allows cafe worker to treat nan at Christmas - BBC News
text: Dr Robert Bowen, a business lecturer at Cardiff University, said the new legislation would make things “fairer” for workers.

title: Tipping: New law allows cafe worker to treat nan at Christmas - BBC News
text: He said: “It’s true in some instances that business do withhold tips from staff, so this will stop that from happening.

title: Tipping: New law allows cafe worker to treat nan at Christmas - BBC News
text: “Businesses will have to put a code of practice in place, they’ll have to come up with their own processes of how they deal with tips.

title: Tipping: New law allows cafe worker to treat nan at Christmas - BBC News
text: “They’ll collect all of the tips in, they’ll have to pay tax on those tips, and then how the tips are paid out is up to the business.

title: Tipping: New law allows cafe worker to treat nan at Christmas - BBC News
text: “They’re allowed to do that on the basis of experience, but they can’t discriminate on age or gender or whether workers have a disability.”

title: Tipping: New law allows cafe worker to treat nan at Christmas - BBC News
text: In Swansea city centre, shoppers welcomed the change.

title: Tipping: New law allows cafe worker to treat nan at Christmas - BBC News
text: Glenda Keane said: “The staff work hard for their money so wherever we go we do tip, you give it abroad so why not here?”

title: Tipping: New law allows cafe worker to treat nan at Christmas - BBC News
text: Joe Young said he had worked in many different roles in hospitality over the past four years.

title: Tipping: New law allows cafe worker to treat nan at Christmas - BBC News
text: “You work hard for your tips, and there’s different work ethics that people bring to work,” he said.

title: Tipping: New law allows cafe worker to treat nan at Christmas - BBC News
text: “Some people give a lot more than others, so I believe you should be able to keep the tips you get.

title: Tipping: New law allows cafe worker to treat nan at Christmas - BBC News
text: “It does make a big difference, and some people do rely on tips.”

title: Tipping: New law allows cafe worker to treat nan at Christmas - BBC News
text: Christina Cole added: “I do tip when I can. If you get good service, then it’s important to be nice back.”

title: Fast fashion giant Shein finds child labour cases in supply chain - BBC News
text: Chinese fast fashion giant Shein says it found two cases of child labour in its supply chain last year as it tightens scrutiny of the companies that make the clothes it sells.

title: Fast fashion giant Shein finds child labour cases in supply chain - BBC News
text: The firm says it temporarily suspended orders from the suppliers involved and did not resume business with them until they had stepped up efforts to tackle the issue.

title: Fast fashion giant Shein finds child labour cases in supply chain - BBC News
text: The revelation in Shein's 2023 sustainability report, external comes as it is understood to be planning to sell shares on the stock market.

title: Fast fashion giant Shein finds child labour cases in supply chain - BBC News
text: The company has been criticised for the conditions faced by workers at factories in its supply chain.

title: Fast fashion giant Shein finds child labour cases in supply chain - BBC News
text: "Both cases were resolved swiftly, with remediation steps including terminating contracts with underage employees, ensuring the payment of any outstanding wages, arranging medical checkups and facilitating repatriation to parents/legal guardians as needed," Shein said.

title: Fast fashion giant Shein finds child labour cases in supply chain - BBC News
text: "Following appropriate remediation, the contract manufacturers were permitted to resume business."

title: Fast fashion giant Shein finds child labour cases in supply chain - BBC News
text: Shein said it has now tightened its supplier policies. Under the new rules, any child labour or forced labour violations have become grounds for immediate termination of contracts.

title: Fast fashion giant Shein finds child labour cases in supply chain - BBC News
text: The firm said the two cases were uncovered during the first nine months of 2023 and none were found in the last quarter of the year.

title: Fast fashion giant Shein finds child labour cases in supply chain - BBC News
text: It comes as the company lays the groundwork for a potential sale of shares on the stock market.

title: Fast fashion giant Shein finds child labour cases in supply chain - BBC News
text: The BBC understands that Shein filed initial documents for a London listing earlier this year.

title: Fast fashion giant Shein finds child labour cases in supply chain - BBC News
text: In June, Marco Rubio, a leading Republican on the US Senate Intelligence Committee, and an ally of Donald Trump, wrote to then-UK Chancellor Jeremy Hunt warning him about "grave ethics concerns" and Shein’s "deep ties to the People’s Republic of China".

title: Fast fashion giant Shein finds child labour cases in supply chain - BBC News
text: “Slave labour, sweat shops, and trade tricks are the dirty secrets behind Shein’s success,” Mr Rubio wrote in his letter to Mr Hunt.

title: Fast fashion giant Shein finds child labour cases in supply chain - BBC News
text: At the time, a spokesperson for the company said: "Shein has a zero-tolerance policy for forced labour and we are committed to respecting human rights. We take visibility across our entire supply chain seriously and we require our contract manufacturers to only source cotton from approved regions."

title: Fast fashion giant Shein finds child labour cases in supply chain - BBC News
text: That was just weeks after a report released by Swiss advocacy group Public Eye said excessive overtime was still common for many workers in Shein's supply chain.

title: Fast fashion giant Shein finds child labour cases in supply chain - BBC News
text: In response to the report, Shein told the BBC it was "working hard" to address the matters raised by Public Eye and had made "significant progress on enhancing conditions".

title: Homes and retail outlet plans in Nether Stowey are 'unacceptable' - BBC News
text: Plans for dozens of new homes have been rejected, after a council called the plans "unacceptable".

title: Homes and retail outlet plans in Nether Stowey are 'unacceptable' - BBC News
text: F. & G. Jeanes & Sons Ltd. applied for permission to build 83 homes and a retail outlet in Nether Stowey.

title: Homes and retail outlet plans in Nether Stowey are 'unacceptable' - BBC News
text: The Cannington-based company has since revised the proposals and reduced the number of homes to 57.

title: Homes and retail outlet plans in Nether Stowey are 'unacceptable' - BBC News
text: However, Somerset Council ruled the plans are still "unacceptable", due to a lack of local services and the impact on the local environment.

title: Homes and retail outlet plans in Nether Stowey are 'unacceptable' - BBC News
text: The site lies on the northern edge of the Quantock Hills national landscape, on the main road between Bridgwater and Minehead.

title: Homes and retail outlet plans in Nether Stowey are 'unacceptable' - BBC News
text: The development would have been delivered less than a mile from the Cricketer Farm site, where 109 homes are currently being constructed by Strongvox Homes – with a further 58 homes being granted permission in June.

title: Homes and retail outlet plans in Nether Stowey are 'unacceptable' - BBC News
text: A spokesperson for the developer, said: “A high-quality, responsive and sustainable development is achievable and deliverable on this site.

title: Homes and retail outlet plans in Nether Stowey are 'unacceptable' - BBC News
text: “The development proposals fully accord with national planning policy, and there are no adverse impacts arising from the proposals that would significantly and demonstrably outweigh the benefits this development will deliver.”

title: Homes and retail outlet plans in Nether Stowey are 'unacceptable' - BBC News
text: The council said the development “does not fulfil a defined housing need” and does not deliver prioritised infrastructure – therefore it does not meet the criterion of “exceptional” circumstances

title: Homes and retail outlet plans in Nether Stowey are 'unacceptable' - BBC News
text: It added that the proposal will “result in a substantial urbanising effect” of the edge of the Quantock Hills without mitigating the existing sewer easement at the site’s western edge.

title: Homes and retail outlet plans in Nether Stowey are 'unacceptable' - BBC News
text: The developer has not yet indicated whether they will appeal this decision.

title: Homes and retail outlet plans in Nether Stowey are 'unacceptable' - BBC News
